By Roman custom, February 24 is doubled in a [[leap year]] in the [[Julian calendar]]. The [[Mercedonius|Mensis Intercalaris]] began on this day or the following day in intercalary years in the [[Roman calendar|pre-Julian calendar]].  This custom still has some effect around the world; for example, with respect to [[name days in Hungary]].

==Events==
* [[303]] &ndash; [[Galerius]] publishes his edict that begins the [[Diocletianic Persecution|persecution of Christians]] in his portion of the [[Roman Empire]].
* [[484]] &ndash; King [[Huneric]] removes the Christian [[bishops]] from their offices and banished some to [[Corsica]]. A few are [[martyr]]ed, including former proconsul [[Victorian, Frumentius and Companions|Victorian along with Frumentius]] and other [[merchant]]s. They are killed at [[Hadrumetum]] after refusing to become [[Arianism|Arians]].
*[[1303]] &ndash; [[Battle of Roslin]], of the [[First War of Scottish Independence]].
*[[1387]] &ndash; King [[Charles III of Naples]] and [[Hungary]] is assassinated at [[Buda]].
*[[1525]] &ndash; Spanish-Imperial army defeat French army at [[Battle of Pavia]].
*[[1538]] &ndash; [[Treaty of Nagyvarad]] between [[Ferdinand I, Holy Roman Emperor|Ferdinand I]] and [[John Zápolya]].
*[[1582]] &ndash; [[Pope Gregory XIII]] announces the [[Gregorian calendar]].
*[[1607]] &ndash; ''[[L'Orfeo]]'' by [[Claudio Monteverdi]], one of the first works recognized as an [[opera]], receives its première performance.
*[[1711]] &ndash; The [[London]] première of ''[[Rinaldo (opera)|Rinaldo]]'' by [[George Frideric Handel]], the first [[Italian language|Italian]] [[opera]] written for the [[London]] stage.
*[[1803]] &ndash; In ''[[Marbury v. Madison]]'', the [[Supreme Court of the United States]] establishes the principle of [[judicial review]].
*[[1809]] &ndash; London's [[Theatre Royal, Drury Lane|Drury Lane Theatre]] burns to the ground, leaving owner [[Richard Brinsley Sheridan]] destitute.
*[[1822]] &ndash; The first [[Swaminarayan temple]] in the world, [[Shri Swaminarayan Mandir, Ahmedabad]], is inaugurated.
*[[1826]] &ndash; The signing of the [[Treaty of Yandaboo]] marks the end of the [[First Burmese War]].
*[[1831]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of Dancing Rabbit Creek]], the first removal treaty in accordance with the [[Indian Removal Act]], is proclaimed. The [[Choctaw]]s in [[Mississippi]] cede land east of the river in exchange for payment and land in the [[West]].
*[[1848]] &ndash; [[List of French monarchs|King]] [[Louis-Philippe of France]] abdicates the throne.
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[Arizona]] is organized as a [[Political divisions of the United States|United States territory]].
*[[1868]] &ndash; [[Andrew Johnson]] becomes the first [[President of the United States]] to be [[Impeachment of Andrew Johnson|impeached]] by the [[United States House of Representatives]]. He is later acquitted in the [[United States Senate|Senate]].
*[[1875]] &ndash; The {{SS|Gothenburg}} hits the [[Great Barrier Reef]] and sinks off the [[Australian]] east coast, killing approximately 100, including a number of high profile civil servants and dignitaries.
*[[1881]] &ndash; [[China]] and [[Russia]] sign the Sino-Russian Ili Treaty.
*[[1895]] &ndash; [[Revolution]] breaks out in [[Baire]], a town near [[Santiago de Cuba]], beginning the [[Cuban War of Independence]], that ends with the [[Spanish-American War]] in 1898.
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[Governor-General of Korea]] established clinic called ''Jahyewon'' in [[Sorokdo]] to segregate [[Hansen's disease|Hansen's disease patients]]. 
*[[1917]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: The [[United States|U.S.]] ambassador to the [[United Kingdom]] is given the [[Zimmermann Telegram]], in which [[Germany]] pledges to ensure the return of [[New Mexico]], [[Texas]], and [[Arizona]] to [[Mexico]] if Mexico declares war on the [[United States]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[Estonian Declaration of Independence]].
*[[1920]] &ndash; The [[Nazi Party]] is founded.
*[[1942]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Los Angeles]], one of the largest documented UFO sightings in history; the event lasted into the early hours of February 25.
*  1942   &ndash; An order-in-council passed under the [[Defence of Canada Regulations]] of the [[War Measures Act]] gives the [[Government of Canada|Canadian federal government]] the power to [[Japanese Canadian internment|intern all "persons of Japanese racial origin"]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[Merrill's Marauders]]: The Marauders begin their 1,000-mile journey through Japanese occupied Burma.
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[Egypt]]ian [[Premier]] [[Ahmed Maher Pasha]] is killed in [[Parliament of Egypt|Parliament]] after reading a decree.
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: The [[Tet Offensive]] is halted; [[South Vietnam]] recaptures [[Hué]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; The [[All India Forward Bloc]] holds an emergency central committee meeting after its chairman, Hemantha Kumar Bose, is killed 3 days earlier. P.K. Mookiah Thevar is appointed as the new chairman.
*[[1976]] &ndash; [[Cuba]]: [[Constitution of Cuba#1976 Constitution|national Constitution]] is proclaimed.
*[[1980]] &ndash; The United States [[Ice hockey at the Olympic Games|Olympic Hockey]] team completes their [[Miracle on Ice]] by defeating [[Finland]] 4-2 to win the gold medal.
*[[1981]] &ndash; An earthquake registering 6.7 on the [[Richter magnitude scale|Richter scale]] hits [[Athens]], killing 16 people and destroying buildings in several towns west of the city.
*[[1983]] &ndash; A special commission of the [[Congress of the United States|U.S. Congress]] releases a report that condemns the practice of [[Japanese American internment|Japanese internment]] during [[World War II]].
*[[1984]] &ndash; [[Tyrone Mitchell]] perpetrates the 49th Street Elementary School shooting in Los Angeles, killing two children and injuring 12 more.
*[[1989]] &ndash; [[Ayatollah]] [[Ruhollah Khomeini]] offers a [[US$]]3 million [[The Satanic Verses controversy|bounty for the death]] of ''[[The Satanic Verses (novel)|The Satanic Verses]]'' author [[Salman Rushdie]].
*  1989   &ndash; [[United Airlines Flight 811]], bound for [[New Zealand]] from [[Honolulu, Hawaii]], rips open during flight, blowing 9 passengers out of the business-class section.
*[[1996]] &ndash; The last occurrence of February 24 as a [[leap day]] in the [[European Union]] and for the [[Roman Catholic Church]].
*[[1999]] &ndash; The [[U.S. State|State]] of [[Arizona]] executes [[Karl LaGrand]], a [[Germany|German]] national convicted of murder during a botched bank robbery, in spite of [[Germany]]'s legal action to attempt to save him.
*[[2006]] &ndash; [[Philippines|Philippine]] [[President of the Philippines|President]] [[Gloria Macapagal-Arroyo]] declares [[Proclamation 1017]] placing the country in a [[2006 state of emergency in the Philippines|state of emergency]] in attempt to subdue a possible military coup.
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[Japan]] launches its fourth [[spy satellite]], stepping up its ability to monitor potential threats such as [[North Korea]].
*[[2008]] &ndash; [[Fidel Castro]] retires as the [[President of Cuba]] after nearly fifty years.
*[[2011]] &ndash; Final Launch of Space Shuttle ''[[Space Shuttle Discovery|Discovery]]''  (OV-103).
